sentence.Network_en: Rather, he depended on America for one element of his dialectic.
sentence.Network_cn: 毋宁说, 他靠美国支持他辩证观点中的一个因素.

sentence.Network_en: Dialectic studies how opposites can become identical.
sentence.Network_cn: 辩证法研究对立物是怎样变统一的.

sentence.Network_en: He was a master of dialectic, could be even in the next sentence, stupidly dogmatic.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一个雄辩的大师, 但会在接下来的话中, 甚至变成愚蠢的教条主义.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French dialectique or Latin dialectica, from Greek dialektikē (tekhnē) ('art) of debate', from dialegesthai 'converse with' (see dialogue)

entry.tran: 辩证关系;(两种力量或因素之间的)对立统一
entry.def: People refer to the dialectic or dialectics of a situation when they are referring to the way in which two very different forces or factors work together, and the way in which their differences are resolved.

example.ex: ...the intricate dialectic of these two contrasting concepts.
example.tran: 这两个相互对立的概念之间错综复杂的辩证关系

example.ex: ...the dialectics of class struggle and of socio-economic change.
example.tran: 阶级斗争的对立统一和社会经济变革的对立统一

entry.def: In philosophy, dialectics is a method of reasoning and reaching conclusions by considering theories and ideas together with ones that contradict them.

means.word_mean: 1. any formal system of reasoning that arrives at the truth by the exchange of logical arguments
2. a contradiction of ideas that serves as the determining factor in their interaction;

sentences.sentence: "this situation created the inner dialectic of American history"

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or employing dialectic;

auth_sentence.content: Kern's central idea is the specificity-uncertainty dialectic.

auth_sentence.content: "Democracy" is one way to define the dialectic.

auth_sentence.content: It was part of the dialectic, our looks of thoughtful disapproval.

dia穿过,二者之间,对着+gon角+al物→对着角的线,斜线
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+gram图→交叉对着画→图表
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+lect讲+ic→二人对讲→辩证法
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+logu话+e→对着说话
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+meter测量→对着测量[圆]直径
